q: "We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it." Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Isnilon Hapilon al-Zarqawi, a Jordanian extremist with ties to the al-Qaida terrorist network. I came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that some had tried to raid the museum by force last night," Zahi Hawass , chairman of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said on Saturday. Egyptian citizens tried to prevent them and were joined by the tourism police, but some[ looters] managed to enter from above and they destroyed two of the mummies, he said. He added looters had also ransacked the ticket office. Dramatic footage shows anti-government protesters riding Egyptian army tanks through the streets of Cairo.
